title: Lightbulbs Strike Back
description:
Encore episode. Humans have a long history of inventions that shape the world around us: electricity, telephones, computers, music — the list goes on. But as Ainissa Ramirez explains in her new book, The Alchemy of Us, those inventions are shaping us, too.

Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.

itunes:title: Lightbulbs Strike Back
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Encore episode. How one of the most important inventions, artificial light, has shaped us in unexpected ways.
itunes:subtitle: Encore episode. How one of the most important inventions, artificial light, has shaped us in unexpected ways.
